casebody.data:
Thain, Respondent, v. Jones, Appellant. (Superior Court of New York City, General Term. March 2, 1891.) Appeal from special term. Action by Alexander Thain against Charles Jones. From an order directing a reference on the ground that the case involves the examination of a long account, defendant appeals.

Argued before Sedgwick, C. J., and Dugro, J.

John M. Tierney, for appellant. Alexander Thain, in pro. per. Per Curiam.

Order affirmed, with $10 costs.
